name: PROVIDENCE TEACHERS UNION v. PROVIDENCE SCHOOL COMMITTEE
name_abbreviation: Providence Teachers Union v. Providence School Committee

parties: PROVIDENCE TEACHERS UNION v. PROVIDENCE SCHOOL COMMITTEE.

opinions.text:
ORDER
This matter comes before us on a motion by the plaintiff to affirm a judgment of the Superior Court confirming an arbitrator’s award. This motion was filed pursuant to our Rule 16(g). Oral argument was presented by the parties on February 8, 1980. Pursuant to principles enunciated in Jacinto v. Egan, R.I., 391 A.2d 1173 (1978), and Belanger v. Matteson, 115 R.I. 332, 346 A.2d 124 (1975), the motion to affirm is hereby granted.
DORIS, J., did not participate.

attorneys: Abedon, Michaelson, Stanzler, Biener, Skolnik & Lipsey, Julius C. Michaelson, Providence, for plaintiff.
Vincent J. Piccirilli, Providence, for defendant.
casebody.head_matter:
PROVIDENCE TEACHERS UNION v. PROVIDENCE SCHOOL COMMITTEE.
No. 79-236-Appeal.
Supreme Court of Rhode Island.
March 19, 1980.
Abedon, Michaelson, Stanzler, Biener, Skolnik & Lipsey, Julius C. Michaelson, Providence, for plaintiff.
Vincent J. Piccirilli, Providence, for defendant.
